G5217-d-07-15-02-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Other track geometry defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G5217-d-07-15-02-WC.Accident Cause: Other track geometry defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
G5217-d-07-15-02-WC.Narrative: TRAIN, M34961-15, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES, 53 LOADS AND 54 EMPTIES WAS OPERATING UNDER CTC AT 50.1 MPH ON MAIN LINE TRACK WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CREW SAW FIRE AND SMOKE, STOPPED THEIR TRAIN AND FOUND THAT 34 CARS HAD DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE DERAILMENT FOUND THE CAUSE WAS DUETO FAILURE TO MAINLINE UNIFORM TOP OF RAIL PROFILE CAUSED BY STEEL CROSSTIES NOT MAINTAINING COMPACTION OF BALLAST.  VOIDS UNDER STEEL CROSSTIES ALLOWED TRACK SURFACE TO DETERIORATE UNDER LOAD.  THECREW WAS WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  TWENTY-SEVEN OF THE 34 CARS DERAILED WERE DESTROYED DUE TO THE DERAILMENT.  LADING IN A NUMBER OF THE DERAILED CARS HAD STARTED ON FIRE AND WERE SMOLDERING, NONE WERE HAZARDOUS CARS.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ME171V-d-07-11-02-NIRC.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 8:55 A.M. EMPTY EQUIPMENT TRAIN NO. 710 WITH 6 EMU CARS NOS. 1606, 1541, 1608, 1655, 1656, AND 1581 (NORTH TO SOUTH) DERAILED ON THE CROSSOVER FROM TRACK NO. 1 TO TRACK NO. 2 AT THE NORTH END OF 11TH PLACE.  THE TRAIN WAS BEING OPERATED AT 16 MPH WITHIN YARD LIMITS FROM THE SOUTH CONTROL CAB.    FIVE (5) CARS HAD TRAVERSED THE SWITCH BEFORE THE SOUTH END OF THE NORTH CAR CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT (A #10 SWITCH) ABOUT 15 1/2 INCHES FROM THE POINT.  THE FLANGE CLIMBED ONTO THE POINT RAIL AND TRAVELED ABOUT 5 FEET BEFORE FALLING TO THE FIELD SIDE AND FOLLOWED THE STOCK RAIL UNTILIT PULLED THE NORTH END OF THE 5TH CAR OFF THE RAIL.  THESE TWO (2) CARS (NOS. 1606 AND 1541) CAME INTO CONTACT WITH CATENARY STRUCTURE 1.22 TEARING IT FROM THE GROUND AND MOVING IT SOME 24 FEET TO THE SOUTH.  THERE WERE NO DEFECTS NOTED TO THE SWITCH POINT AND NO DEFECTS WERE NOTED WITH THE WHEELSAND FLANGE ON CAR NO. 1606.  IT APPEARS THE SOUTH WHEEL OF NORTH CAR NO. 1606 CLIMBED THE RAIL DUE TO LACK OF RAIL LUBRICATION.NoneNoneNoneNone

I0902-d-07-08-02-PATH.Narrative: THE OPERATOR ON THE HI-RAIL VEHICLE AND THE PILOT WERE INSTRUCTED TO PROCEED FROM 22 TRACK IN C-YARDCROSSING OVER TO TRACK 3 AT JOURNAL SQUARE.  HI-RAIL WORK RIGHTS WERE BETWEEN TRACK 3 AND THE BUMPING BLOCK ON TRACK 5.  AFTER CROSSING OVER TO TRACK 3, THE CRANE ON TOP OF THE VEHICLE HIT THE OVERHEAD ROTUNDA, CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO STOP.  UPON INSPECTION OF THE ROTUNDA, IT APPEARED THAT 8 CEILINGTILES WERE DAMAGED, AS WELL AS THE FASCIA ENTERING TRACK 3.  ENGINEERING ESTIMATES THE DAMAGE TO BEAPPROXIMATELY $25,000.  THE PILOT ON THE VEHICLE SUSTAINED A MINOR NECK INJURY BUT DID NOT LOSE TIME.  THE CAUSE IS DETERMINED TO BE MISCELLANEOUS LOADING PROCEDURES.  THE HI-RAIL VEHICLE MISSED CLEARING THE ROTUNDA BY APPOXIMATELY 2 INCHES.  THE CONTRACTOR NOR EMPLOYEE IN CHARGE TOLD THE TRAINMASTER OF A POSSIBLE CLEARANCE PROBLEM.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

IC02392-d-07-06-02-DGNO.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to properly secure engine(s) (railroad employee)

IC02392-d-07-06-02-DGNO.Narrative: ON JULY 6TH AN EXTRA MILITARY TRAIN OF 38 CARS WAS CALLED ON DUTY AT 6P.M.  AT APPROXIMATELY 1045 P.M. DGNO ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR WERE TRAVELING NORTHBOUND AT APPROXIMATELY 12 MPH ON THE KCS MAINLINEAT LAKELAND DR. ROAD CROSSING.  THEY NOTICED A LOCOMOTIVE WITH NO LIGHTS ON, BUT REFLECTIVE TAPE HEADING SOUTH TOWARD THEM.  THE CONDUCTOR JUMPED OFF THE LEAD ENGINE AT THE ROAD CROSSING.  THE ENGINEER PUT HIS TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY AND THEN ALSO JUMPED OFF THE ENGINE JUST PRIOR TO IMPACT.  THE HEADON COLLISION WAS A RESULT OF TWO UNOCCUPIED KCS LOCOMOTIVES THAT TRAVELED FROM KCS ZACHA YARD APPROXIMATELY 3 MILES PRIOR TO THE COLLISION.  THERE WERE TWO DGNO EMPLOYEES REQUIRING THE TESTING.  THE ENGINEER WAS TRANSPORTED TO BAYLOR MEDICAL CENTER TO RECEIVE TREATMENT FOR INJURIES TO HIS LEFT KNEEAND WAS TESTED AND ALL TESTS REPORTED NEGATIVE.  THE CONDUCTOR ABSENTED HIMSELF AND WENT AWOL APPROXIMATELY 2 A.M. ON JULY 7TH, 2002.  THE CONDUCTOR REFUSED TO SUBMIT TO ANY TESTING.  AS A RESULT, HEWAS REMOVED FROM COVERED SERVICES FOR A MINIMUM OF NINE MONTHS.  THE CONDUCTOR IS ALSO REQUIRED TO ATTEND AN INVESTIGATION ON TUESDAY JULY 16TH, 2002 AT 1300 PM.NoneNoneNone
